abstract: The French president suggested that banks could make profits by taking out cheap loans from the European Central Bank and investing that money in the region’s government bonds. New data show how popular that trade has become.
snippet: The French president suggested that banks could make profits by taking out cheap loans from the European Central Bank and investing that money in the region’s government bonds. New data show how popular that trade has become.
lead_paragraph: If Nicolas Sarkozy loses France’s presidential election, he may want to set up a hedge fund.

headline.main: Forget ‘Zou Bisou Bisou,’ ‘the Sarkozy Trade’ Is the Hot French Export
